cycle_summaries.summary: First v2 construct-first landscape mapping cycle. Scanned 25 structural signals across 7 source categories. Graded all 25 above threshold (4/10). Clustered into 14 opportunity themes. Constructed 20 distinct business models across 13 verified opportunities. 4 Tier 1, 4 Tier 2, 5 Tier 3.

key_patterns_identified.name: PE Distress + AI Cost Collapse Double Disruption
Jevons Expansion Consistently 3-5x in Professional Services

under_explored_areas: Agriculture/AgTech AI (Davis, CA location could be an advantage)
Manufacturing quality control / supply chain AI
Robotics x AI in physical production
VC/angel capital allocation rotation signals
next_cycle_direction: Expanded scope: Add physical production/manufacturing/robotics landscape
Deep competitor analysis on Tier 1 services
Capital allocation signals from asset managers

cycle_summaries.summary: EXPANDED SCOPE cycle. Added physical production/manufacturing/robotics landscape alongside deepened services analysis. Scanned 42 signals across ALL 8 source categories (including new Category 8: Manufacturing/Robotics/Physical Production). Graded 38 above threshold. Clustered into 18 opportunity themes. Constructed 32 business models across 16 verified opportunities. 5 Tier 1, 5 Tier 2, 6 Tier 3. NEW: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition enters Tier 1 at rank 3. Physical/production landscape mapped for first time.

tier_1.name: SMB Accounting/Finance (Service Layer)
tier_1.cycle_2_change: Score -1 (tool layer crowding). Thesis SHARPENED: build at service/full-service layer, not tool layer. CA AB 1175 lowers CPA entry barrier.

tier_1.name: Healthcare Admin AI (Independent Practices)
tier_1.cycle_2_change: Score +1. CMS WISeR model = government endorsing AI in healthcare admin. HIPAA infra commoditizing. Target independent practices, not enterprise.

tier_1.name: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition
tier_1.cycle_2_change: NEW Tier 1 entry. SBA 504 fee waiver + retiring-owner acquisition + cobot modernization = viable sub-$8M physical play.

tier_1.name: Insurance Claims AI
tier_1.cycle_2_change: Score unchanged. Competitive sparsity CONFIRMED (<$20M total startup funding for $40B+ market). NAIC model law strengthens moat timeline.

tier_1.name: AI-First Legal Services (SMB)
tier_1.cycle_2_change: Score unchanged. Harvey $8B VALIDATES structural force. Counter-signal analyzed: Harvey = sustaining, SMB = disruptive. Clear differentiation.

tier_2.name: Specialty Food/Beverage Production AI + Robotics
tier_2.cycle_2_change: NEW. Acquire retiring food producer + cobot/AI modernization. USDA VAPG + SBA 504 capital stack. BEST FIT production category.

tier_2.name: PE Distress Cascade
tier_2.cycle_2_change: Score -1. Now applies to both services AND manufacturing. Distress rate 11.98% (+148%).

tier_2.name: Precision Agriculture (Davis CA)
tier_2.cycle_2_change: NEW. UC Davis Farm Robotics ecosystem. Central Valley specialty crops. Founder location advantage.

tier_2.name: AI Regulatory Compliance
tier_2.cycle_2_change: Unchanged. 250+ state AI healthcare bills strengthen thesis.

tier_2.name: US-LATAM AI Services + Manufacturing
tier_2.cycle_2_change: EXPANDED from services-only. LATAM factory automation $20B+ market. Nearshoring creates demand for bilingual AI integration services.

tier_3.name: Capital Allocation Rotation (validation signal)
tier_3.cycle_2_change: NEW. Not directly investable but confirms physical plays are fundable.

tier_3.name: Skilled Trades AI Operations
tier_3.cycle_2_change: Score -4. Lower priority vs manufacturing and food production opportunities.

tier_3.name: Construction Prefab/Modular Robotics
tier_3.cycle_2_change: NEW. Over budget for direct factory. FaaS integration service possible.

key_patterns_identified.name: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence
key_patterns_identified.update: All 4 services Tier 1 continue strengthening.

key_patterns_identified.name: Demographic Gap + AI Readiness (EXPANDED to manufacturing)
key_patterns_identified.update: Silver Tsunami adds 2.34M boomer-owned businesses to demographic gap.

key_patterns_identified.name: Regulatory Fragmentation as Structural Moat (DEEPENED)
key_patterns_identified.update: CMS WISeR, HIPAA update, NAIC model law, Colorado AI Act all strengthen.

key_patterns_identified.name: PE Distress Double Disruption (BROADENED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Distress rate 11.98%. Now applies to manufacturing acquisitions too.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Robotics x AI Compound Production Cost Compression
key_patterns_identified.update: 9 independent signals. IFR data, PMI divergence, cobot adoption, 98% interest but 20% readiness.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Capital Allocation Rotation to Hard-Tech/Physical
key_patterns_identified.update: a16z $1.18B, VC robotics $6B+, BlackRock overweight industrials, JPM supercycle broadening.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Manufacturing Credit Structure Advantage (SBA 504)
key_patterns_identified.update: SBA 504 fee waiver through Sept 2026. TIME-SENSITIVE enabler.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Christensen Sustaining vs Disruptive Distinction
key_patterns_identified.update: Consistent across accounting, legal, healthcare: tool-layer competitors are sustaining, service-layer opportunity is disruptive.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Silver Tsunami Acquisition Window
key_patterns_identified.update: 2.34M businesses, $10T transfer, 58% no succession plan.

transmission_chains_status.note: 200x/year price drops. Application layer economics now deeply viable.
Tool-layer saturating, service-layer opening. Christensen distinction clear.
CMS WISeR model = government endorsement. Accelerating.
NEW chain. Installations doubling, PMI diverging, but SME adoption still early.
NEW chain. Silver Tsunami actively materializing. Assets available.
NEW chain. Asset managers allocating, VC funds forming. Downstream effects in 12-24mo.
Factory automation market growing. Reflex Robotics Mexico. Integration services needed.
Legislation proliferating rapidly. First-mover compliance advantage widening.
Digital correction, physical capital flows. Build crash-resilient.

under_explored_areas: Specific acquisition targets (need BizBuySell/LoopNet live screening)
SBA 504 actual approval rates and timelines for first-time acquirers
CMS WISeR model participation pathway for startups
Service-layer competitive density (vs tool-layer which we've mapped well)
UC Davis partnership structures for Davis-based AI companies
Specific LATAM country regulatory environments for AI claims processing
Government/municipal services AI (large Baumol sector, unclear regulatory path)
Real estate transaction AI (large market but competitive density unknown)
Mental health / therapy AI (regulatory moat forming, Utah first law)

cycle_2_key_findings.finding_1: Physical production IS viable at sub-$15M. SBA 504 fee waiver + retiring-owner acquisition at 2-4x EBITDA + cobot modernization = $3-8M total entry cost for a manufacturing play with real moats (equipment, permits, customer contracts).
cycle_2_key_findings.finding_2: The Christensen sustaining/disruptive distinction is THE competitive lens for 2026. Across accounting, legal, and healthcare, well-funded competitors are building tools for incumbents. The disruptive opportunity (AI-first service for underserved markets) remains nearly empty.
cycle_2_key_findings.finding_3: Capital allocation has decisively rotated toward hard-tech/physical. a16z American Dynamism ($1.18B), BlackRock overweight industrials, VC robotics $6B+. Physical/production AI plays are now 'sexy' for funders.
cycle_2_key_findings.finding_4: SBA 504 fee waiver for manufacturers expires Sept 30, 2026. This is a TIME-SENSITIVE enabling structure that makes FY2026 the optimal entry window for manufacturing acquisition plays.
cycle_2_key_findings.finding_5: Davis CA location advantage is REAL for precision agriculture and food production. UC Davis Farm Robotics ecosystem, Central Valley specialty crops, food production cluster. This isn't just geographic convenience -- it's a structural moat.

next_cycle_direction: Screen real acquisition targets (BizBuySell, LoopNet, broker outreach)
Model SBA 504 + equipment financing capital stacks for specific scenarios
Service-layer competitive density analysis across top 4 services opportunities
Customer discovery interviews across top opportunities
CMS WISeR model participation pathway research

cycle_summaries.summary: DEEPENING & CORRECTION cycle. Real data replaces estimates across manufacturing acquisition, food production, SBA 504, competitive density, and O*NET task classification. Scanned 38 signals including 10 counter-signals (2+ per Tier 1 opportunity). Constructed 34 business models. KEY CORRECTIONS: Legal AI DEMOTED from Tier 1 to Tier 2 (score -7, Lawhive $60M Series B closes service layer gap). Insurance Claims AI score -3 (4% scaling rate, 70% customer mistrust). Healthcare Admin AI score -2, REFRAMED to provider-side (WISeR vendor selection closed). Food/Beverage Production PROMOTED from Tier 2 to Tier 1 (score +2, confirmed with real listings and unit economics). Manufacturing Acquisition score +1, CONFIRMED with BizBuySell data and modeled capital stack. SBA 504 CORRECTED: first-time buyers need 15% down (not 10%). USDA VAPG corrected to $250K max. 2 new patterns identified: Embedded AI Commoditizing Tool Layer (P-011) and Provider-Side Healthcare AI Arms Race (P-012).

tier_1.name: SMB Accounting/Finance (Full-Service Layer)
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score -1. Service layer no longer empty (Basis, Docyt). Embedded AI in Xero/Intuit threatens tool layer. FULL-SERVICE layer remains empty. Unit economics: $0.05/month inference per client. Target: 23M unserved single-entity SMBs.

tier_1.name: Healthcare Admin AI (Provider-Side)
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score -2, REFRAMED. WISeR vendor selection CLOSED (6 vendors identified: Cohere, Genzeon, Humata, Innovaccer, Virtix, Zyter). Congressional repeal bill. PROVIDER-SIDE opportunity strengthened. Horizontal platform across ALL practice types = gap (competitors hyper-specialized). Arms race dynamic: payer AI vs provider AI.

tier_1.name: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score +1, CONFIRMED WITH REAL DATA. BizBuySell: 379 CA manufacturing for sale, median $600K. CNC shops: $1.25-3M asking, $1-2M revenue, $300-400K EBITDA. Capital stack modeled: $3M acquisition + $500K modernization, $18K/mo debt service covered by $29K/mo EBITDA. SBA 504 at 5.85%. CORRECTION: 15% equity for first-time buyers.

tier_1.name: Specialty Food/Beverage Production
tier_1.cycle_3_change: PROMOTED from Tier 2. Score +2. BizBuySell: 77 CA food production for sale. Wholesale bakery: $1.7M revenue, $500K profit, 300+ stores. Unit economics modeled: acquire at $1-1.5M, add cobots $200-300K, margin uplift from 29% to 35-45%. BEST FIT for robotics x AI. USDA VAPG corrected to $250K max.

tier_1.name: Insurance Claims AI (SMB/TPA)
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score -3. 78% adopted but only 4% SCALED = implementation much harder. 70% customer mistrust. Hallucination liability risk. Microsoft + Cognizant deploying enterprise = squeeze from above. BUT: SMB/TPA layer (1,200+ TPAs) remains underserved. SLOWER opportunity than assumed.

tier_2.name: AI-First Legal Services (SMB Corporate Niche)
tier_2.cycle_3_change: DEMOTED from Tier 1. Score -7. Lawhive $60M Series B, $35M ARR, 7x growth, expanding to 35 US states. Service layer CLOSING. 37% SMBs already using AI for legal. Remaining niche: SMB corporate legal (contracts, employment, IP) where Lawhive doesn't focus.

tier_2.name: PE Distress Cascade
tier_2.cycle_3_change: Score -1. Tariff uncertainty scares PE = fewer competing buyers = FAVORABLE for individual acquirers. 70% M&A failure rate = operational capability is key risk.

tier_2.name: AI Regulatory Compliance
tier_2.cycle_3_change: Score unchanged. Regulatory landscape continues deepening.

tier_2.name: Precision Agriculture (Davis CA)
tier_2.cycle_3_change: Score -3. OEM competition (Deere See & Spray commercial, CNH, AGCO billions R&D). Seasonal revenue. Capital intensity. Specialty crop niche valid but LONGER timeline than manufacturing.

tier_3.name: Capital Allocation Signals
tier_3.cycle_3_change: Score +2. BlackRock/JPM/Goldman ALL bullish on physical AI. Strongest consensus ever.

key_patterns_identified.name: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence
key_patterns_identified.update: O*NET validation: Bookkeepers 85-90%, Med Records 97%, Claims 65-75%, Paralegals 70% routine-cognitive. Healthcare admin deepest cure.

key_patterns_identified.name: Demographic Gap + AI Readiness (manufacturing CONFIRMED)
key_patterns_identified.update: BizBuySell: 379+77 CA businesses for sale. Real retirement-sale listings at 0.50-1.12x revenue.

key_patterns_identified.name: Regulatory Fragmentation as Moat (COUNTER-SIGNALS noted)
key_patterns_identified.update: WISeR vendor selection closed. Congressional repeal bill. But provider-side opportunity + regulatory complexity = deeper moat for compliant entrants.

key_patterns_identified.name: PE Distress (NUANCED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Tariffs scare PE = fewer competing buyers. Favorable for non-PE acquirers. 70% M&A failure rate = key risk.

key_patterns_identified.name: Jevons Expansion (unit economics CONFIRMED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Inference $0.05/month per client. 4,000x raw cost advantage. Effective 10-50x. 23M unserved SMBs.

key_patterns_identified.name: Robotics x AI Compound (UPGRADED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Upgraded from strong. Real cobot pricing, O*NET task data, BizBuySell targets, capital stack. Partial enhancement (not replacement) for physical production.

key_patterns_identified.name: Capital Allocation Rotation (UPGRADED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Upgraded from strong. BlackRock + JPM + Goldman ALL bullish. Strongest consensus ever for physical AI.

key_patterns_identified.name: SBA 504 Capital Structure (CORRECTED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Upgraded from strong. Rates 5.67-5.91%. CORRECTED: 15% down for first-time buyers. Capital stack modeled end-to-end. Fee waiver expires Sept 30, 2026.

key_patterns_identified.name: Christensen Three-Layer (DEEPENED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Upgraded from strong. Cross-sector validation complete. NEW insight: embedded AI commoditizes tool layer. Service layer emerging. Full-service layer empty.

key_patterns_identified.name: Silver Tsunami (CONFIRMED with real data)
key_patterns_identified.update: Upgraded from strong. BizBuySell listings confirm. Specific CNC shops and food producers identified.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Embedded AI Commoditizing Tool Layer
key_patterns_identified.update: Xero/Intuit, Westlaw/Lexis, EHR vendors embedding AI. Standalone tools face commoditization. Service/full-service insulated.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Provider-Side Healthcare AI Arms Race
key_patterns_identified.update: WISeR payer AI triggers demand for provider AI. AMA: 61% say AI increases denials. Provider-side aligned with physician interests.

transmission_chains_status.note: Goldman $527B capex. $0.05/month inference per client. Overhang deepening.
Tool layer saturating + embedded AI commoditization. Service layer emerging. Full-service is frontier.
WISeR reframed: provider-side. 97% med records automation. Arms race dynamic.
Advanced from N3-N4. Real data confirms. Deloitte: 50% AI adoption growth. SME deployment still early.
CONFIRMED at N5. 379+77 CA businesses for sale. Window open NOW.
Advanced. BlackRock/JPM/Goldman consensus. Downstream effects materializing.
Unchanged. Expansion market.
WISeR + NAIC + Colorado AI Act + 250+ bills. Political risk but trajectory = more regulation.
Goldman $527B confirms installation phase. Application layer = highest conviction.
NEW. Platform vendors embedding AI. Tool layer structural threat.
NEW. WISeR triggers payer AI. Demand for provider AI counter-tools.

cycle_3_key_corrections.correction_1: SBA 504 equity requirement: cycle 2 stated 10% down for all. ACTUAL: first-time buyers (businesses <2 years) need 15% down. On a $3M acquisition: $450K equity (not $300K). Still achievable but higher bar.
cycle_3_key_corrections.correction_2: USDA VAPG amount: cycle 2 stated $200K max. ACTUAL: $250K max. Requires 1:1 match.
cycle_3_key_corrections.correction_3: Legal AI service layer: cycle 2 described as 'sparse.' Lawhive $60M Series B (Feb 5, 2026) reveals service layer RAPIDLY FILLING. Triggered demotion from Tier 1 to Tier 2 (score -7).
cycle_3_key_corrections.correction_4: Healthcare admin WISeR opportunity: cycle 2 framed as entering WISeR. Research shows vendor selection CLOSED and congressional repeal bill. Reframed to PROVIDER-SIDE (helping practices fight AI-powered denials).
cycle_3_key_corrections.correction_5: Manufacturing acquisition integration timeline: cycle 2 implied 3-6 months. Real data suggests 12-18 months realistic. 70% M&A synergy failure rate.

cycle_3_key_findings.finding_1: REAL ACQUISITION DATA confirms thesis: 379 CA manufacturing businesses for sale (median $600K), 77 food production (median $377K). CNC shops at $1.25-3M asking with $300-400K EBITDA. Retirement sales cluster at 3.2-4x EBITDA. Capital stack modeled: $18K/mo debt service covered by $29K/mo pre-modernization EBITDA.
cycle_3_key_findings.finding_2: Christensen three-layer framework is THE competitive insight for 2026. NEW: embedded AI from platform vendors (Xero, Intuit, Westlaw, EHRs) is commoditizing the tool layer. Service layer emerging but still sparse (Basis, Docyt for accounting; Lawhive, Garfield for legal; HealthSpark, Verse for healthcare). Full-service layer EMPTY across all sectors.
cycle_3_key_findings.finding_3: O*NET Polanyi classification provides quantitative backing: Bookkeepers 85-90% routine-cognitive (highest services automation potential), Medical Records 97% (deepest Baumol Cure), Machinists 30% routine-cognitive + 50% tacit-manual (partial enhancement, not replacement). Physical production automation is DIFFERENT from services automation.
cycle_3_key_findings.finding_4: Counter-signals are substantive, not dismissable: Lawhive $60M killed legal Tier 1 thesis. Insurance 4% scaling rate (vs 78% adoption) = real implementation barrier. 70% M&A failure rate adds realism to manufacturing. WISeR vendor selection closed. These corrections make the remaining opportunities MORE credible.
cycle_3_key_findings.finding_5: Capital allocation consensus is the STRONGEST yet: BlackRock ('humanoid robotics most transformative frontier'), JPM (AI supercycle broadening), Goldman ($500B+ AI investment, reindustrialization). All three major asset managers are bullish on physical-economy AI. This validates manufacturing/robotics/food production plays as fundable.

under_explored_areas: Customer discovery interviews (no actual conversations with target customers yet)
SBA 504 actual approval process and timeline for first-time manufacturing acquirers
Cobot integration partners in CA (specific companies, capabilities, timelines)
UC Davis AIFS partnership structures for external companies
EHR integration landscape (which 10-20 EHRs cover 80% of independent practices?)
Lawhive US expansion trajectory (geographic coverage, practice area expansion plans)
CPA licensing acquisition pathway in CA post-AB 1175
Government/municipal services AI (large Baumol sector, completely unmapped)
Mental health / therapy AI (regulatory moat forming, Utah first law)
Real estate transaction AI (competitive density unknown)
next_cycle_direction: Customer discovery interviews (5-10 across top opportunities)
Narrow acquisition target shortlist (5-10 from BizBuySell using specific criteria)
Cobot integration partner identification in CA
Full bear case stress test on #1 opportunity

notes: v2 engine. Previous 11 cycles ran v1 (prosecutorial filtering). v2 uses construct-first landscape mapping. Cycle numbering restarts at 1. Cycle 2 expanded scope to include physical production/manufacturing/robotics. Cycle 3 is the first CORRECTION cycle: real data replaces estimates, counter-signals treated equally, scores moved both up and down.
